title: Hugh Grant complains about ‘unendurable’ loud volume while watching Joker
text:
Caption: Hugh Grant complains about the Joker being too loud in the cinema

(Picture: Getty; AP)

Hugh Grant wasn’t best pleased while watching the Joker in the cinema recently and it’s all thanks to the apparently ‘unendurable’ loud volume.

Like the rest of us, Hugh, 59, flocked to a London cinema last week to watch Joaquin Phoenix’s critically-acclaimed turn as the villainous Batman character in the latest spin-off, which also stars Robert De Niro.

But unfortunately for Hugh, his whole experience was ruined by the booming noise and he just had to tweet about it.

‘Am I old or is the cinema MUCH TOO LOUD? Unendurable. Pointless. @vuecinemas,’ he asked his 451,400 Twitter followers.

Vue Cinemas promptly replied and seemed pretty concerned about Hugh’s poor cinema experience.

The ever-so helpful assistant ‘Rachel’ replied: ‘I’m so sorry for any disappointment felt with the volume levels in our venues Hugh, please be assured we do regularly check these to ensure they comply to health and safety standards.

‘I’ll ensure your feedback is passed on to the relevant teams. Have a great day!’

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Hugh wasn’t satisfied just yet and he wondered: ‘Thanks @vueHelp. But you don’t know which cinema I was in. So how can you pass it on?’

Well in case you were wondering, Hugh watched the Joker at Fulham Broadway on Saturday night in screen seven.

He cheekily added: ‘But joke was on us.’

Joker has proved to be a huge box office success after grossing nearly $300 million (£270 million) worldwide.

And while fans and critics have heaped praise on the latest installment, Hugh isn’t the only one displeased about the Joker.

The Hollywood Reporter claims Jared Leto, who played the Joker in Suicide Squad, felt ‘alienated and upset’ when he discovered the studio approved a solo Joker film that wasn’t connected to the DC Extended Universe.
